revised_title: Rate of Helium Production from Radium
tldr: The author conducted experiments to measure the rate of helium production from radium using a McLeod gauge and a series of cooling and heating processes. The results showed that the rate of helium production was approximately 0.37 cubic millimeters per gram of radium per day. This discovery contributed to the understanding of radioactivity and the behavior of gases produced by radioactive processes.
